title: Baffling Argentina FX rates on borrowed time as election nears
description: The hodgepodge of currency controls put in place in Argentina is likely in its last days.  Leer más

title: Argentina's government gives citizens option to renounce public transport subsidies
description: With a knowing nod to libertarian critics of government, Argentina's Transport Minister Diego Giuliano announces that citizens may now renounce their right to transport subsidies: “Those who agree with a policy of no subsidies may waive it.” Leer más

title: Argentina’s football leaders offer explicit support to Sergio Massa
description: AFA President Claudio Tapia not only shows his support for Sergio Massa’s presidential candidacy, he also predicts in public that the economy minister will be Argentina’s next head of state. With the return of tax exemptions for clubs serving as a key message to the local leaders of the national game, the Unión por la Patria leader continues to develop his power-base in domestic football. Leer más

title: Debt, inflation and the peso: Argentina's election worries
description: As Argentines head to the polls on October 22 for a crucial presidential election, candidates have campaigned hard on proposed elixirs for the country's economic ills. Leer más

title: Jorge Macri: ‘If Patricia Bullrich makes the run-off, she’s president’
description: Buenos Aires City mayoral candidate if confident Juntos por el Cambio will make it into the second round of the presidential election, pointing to “plenty of crossover” between Sergio Massa and Javier Milei and affirming that “the proximity to Luis Barrionuevo shows a dependence on the traditional political mechanisms” on the part of the liberals. Leer más
